ygData.subject: Re: re: Duster Models
ygData.msgSnippet: In reality, the bootstrutter pack IS weight reducing, by 10% as someone earlier posted. If you put something heavy like a two handed sword in it, you ll see
ygData.messageBody:
In reality, the bootstrutter pack IS weight reducing, by 10% as someone
earlier posted. If you put something heavy like a two handed sword in it,
you'll see that it drops a pound or two.

Also, the gnomish glow rods are just light sources, but they look pretty
darn spiffy (like a glowing reddish candle). Besides, it has 'gnomish' in
the name of it, so we should all carry one with pride. ;)

----- Original Message -----
From: Joe D <joed@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, December 15, 1999 6:53 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] re: Duster Models


> From: Joe D <joed@...>
>
> On Wed, Dec 15, 1999 at 06:26:27AM -0800, Quasinom de Plume wrote:
> > From: =?iso-8859-1?q?Quasinom=20de=20Plume?= <eqmailing@...>
> >
> > I can confrim this as I completed the duster quest last night and got
the
> > Bootstrutters Pack (Isn't the Gnome who gives you the Jboots quest named
> > Bootstrutter? Heh - anyone try giving him his pack back? Just an
idea).
>
> I've had one of those packs for a few weeks now. Got it for the Duster
> quest. It's a nice item, but it's NOT a weight-reducing pack. It's just
a
> 10-slot backpack, lore, nodrop.
>
> > These junk items that you talk about - I've never seen them before.
> > Gnomish Glow Rods? Perhaps these are the rods needed for the thermal
> > cloak... I just received a patchwork cloak after completing the Red V
> > quest - I'll try to do the Duster and scrap metal quests a few more
times
> > to get these Rods and try a few combinations.
>
> I also have a Gnome Glow Rod. I got it for turning in scrap metal. As
far
> as I can tell, it's just a light source. I have had comments from people
> asking me what the heck I was carrying, so they don't seem to be that
> common.
>
> Joe D
>
> >
